t: He Will Tread Down Our Foes

To the choirmaster: according to Shushan Eduth. A Miktam of David; for instruction; when he strove with Aram-naharaim and with Aram-zobah, and when Joab on his return struck down twelve thousand of Edom in the Valley of Salt.
O*pn God, you have rejected us, broken our defenses; you*ld have been angry; oh, restore us.
You*ln have made the land to quake; you have torn it open; repair*ld its breaches, for it totters.
You*ln have made your people see hard things; you*ld have given us wine to drink that made us stagger.
You*pn have set up a banner for those who fear you, that*ld they may flee to it from the bow. Selah*ig
That*ln your beloved ones may be delivered, give*ld salvation by your right hand and answer us!
God*pn has spoken in his holiness: “With*ld exultation I will divide up Shechem and*ld portion out the Vale of Succoth.
Gilead*ln is mine; Manasseh is mine; Ephraim*ld is my helmet; Judah*ld is my scepter.
Moab*ln is my washbasin; upon*ld Edom I cast my shoe; over*ld Philistia I shout in triumph.”
Who*pn will bring me to the fortified city? Who*ld will lead me to Edom?
Have*ln you not rejected us, O God? You*ld do not go forth, O God, with our armies.
Oh,*ln grant us help against the foe, for*ld vain is the salvation of man!
With*ln God we shall do valiantly; it*ld is he who will tread down our foes.
